sections.heading: Policies; misrepresentations; warranties; conditions; effect
sections.text: No oral or written misrepresentation or warranty made in the negotiation for a contract or policy of insurance by the insured, or in his behalf, shall be deemed material or defeat or avoid the policy, or prevent its attaching, unless such

sections.heading: not apply to case where insurance company has never entered into contractual relations with person claiming under policy
sections.text: Stephenson v. Germania Fire Ins. Co., 100 Neb. 456, 160 N.W. 962 (1916).

sections.heading: part of fire insurance contract. Westchester Fire Ins. Co. v. Norfolk Bldg. & Loan Assn., 14 F.2d 524 (8th Cir. 1926).
sections.text: part of fire insurance contract. Westchester Fire Ins. Co. v. Norfolk Bldg. & Loan Assn., 14 F.2d 524 (8th Cir. 1926).
